item.title: less known vim tricks
item.author: savolla@protonmail.com (savolla)
item.description: ourput redirection you can redirect outputs of a shell command in vim press ESC :r !ls -la RET whitespace removal remove all trailing whitespaces. you can also make the following a permanent macro press ESC :%s/\s\+$//e RET time travel show the file 10 mins ago press ESC :earlier 10m RET show the file after 10 mins press ESC :later 10m RET
item.dc:creator: [savolla]

item.title: permanent macros in vim
item.author: savolla@protonmail.com (savolla)
item.description: this is a short step by step tutorial to save your vim macro and use it everytime fire up vim do q a create your macro press q to finish exit vim :q! vim ~/.vimrc type let @q = '' put your cursor on first single quote do " a p macro should be pasted inside single quotes like: 1 let @q = 'your_macro_content' save and exit ESC :wq fire up vim again do @ q now you should have your macro saved.

item.title: search code in Github
item.author: savolla@protonmail.com (savolla)
item.description: for example I’m searching for “setq” keyword which exists in “.doom.d” directory, file is called “config.el” and is written in “Emacs Lisp” language go to github search search for the following string 1 setq extension:el path:.doom.d filename:config.el language:"Emacs Lisp" extension:.el
